original: vāyunā calate toyaṃ kṣobhayantaṃ punaḥ punaḥ /
analyzed: vāyunā calate toyam kṣobhayantam punar punar
translated: The water is moved again and again by the wind,

original: niścalatvaṃ na cāstīti tathā citteti durlabham // //
analyzed: niścala tvam na ca asti iti tathā citta iti durlabham
translated: And it has no stillness, so the mind is also difficult to attain.

original: oṃ bhagavandevadeveśa lokanāthajagatpate /
analyzed: om bhagavan devadeveśa lokanātha jagatpate
translated: Om, Blessed One, Lord of the Gods, Lord of the World, Lord of the Universe,

original: saṅkṣepāt kāraṇaṃ brūhi yatra citte suniścalam // //
analyzed: saṅkṣepāt kāraṇam brūhi yatra citte su niścalam
translated: Please tell me in brief the cause where the mind is completely still.

original: sādhu sādhu mahāprājña dṛṣṭaṃ te buddhi kauśalam /
analyzed: sādhu sādhu mahā prājña dṛṣṭam te kauśalam
translated: Very good, very good, O greatly wise one, you have seen the skill of your intellect.

original: kathayāmi na sandehaḥ putra snehādviśeṣataḥ // //
analyzed: kathayāmi na sandehaḥ putra snehāt viśeṣataḥ
translated: I will tell you, O son, especially out of affection.

original: p / trividhaṃ kāraṇaṃ proktaṃ sthūlaṃ sūkṣmaṃ paraṃ ca yat /
analyzed: trividham kāraṇam proktam sthūlam sūkṣmam param ca yat
translated: The cause is said to be threefold, gross, subtle, and supreme.

original: sthūlena rañjitā devā mahāmāyā vaśī kṛtāḥ // //
analyzed: sthūlena rañjitāḥ devāḥ mahāmāyāḥ vaśī kṛtāḥ
translated: The gods are delighted by the gross, and the great illusion is brought under control.

original: kāraṇaṃ tu pravakṣyāmi śṛṇuṣveka manāguha /
analyzed: kāraṇam tu pravakṣyāmi śṛṇuṣva eka manāk uha
translated: But I will explain the cause, listen with a one-pointed mind, O Guha.

original: tālumadhye tu karaṇaṃ niśśvāsocchvāsavarjitam // //🔽nābhihṛddhāmamadhyasthaṃ kandago vandanaṃ manāk /
analyzed: tālu madhye tu karaṇam niśśvāsa ucchvāsa varjitam  nābhi hṛd dhāma madhya stham kanda gaḥ vandanam manāk
translated: The instrument is in the middle of the palate, free from exhalation and inhalation.🔽Situated in the middle of the navel and the abode, the root is slightly bent.

original: tālusaṃjñā bhavet tasya yato vā cāpravartinam // //
analyzed: tālu saṃjñā bhavet tasya yatas vā ca apravartinam
translated: Its designation will be the palate, from which the breath does not move.

original: tatra sthāne kṛtā buddhiścitraṃ tatra suniścalam /
analyzed: tatra sthāne kṛtā buddhiḥ citram tatra su niścalam
translated: The mind made there is variegated and completely still there.

original: niścalaṃ tu yadā cittaṃ tadā dṛṣṭiḥ pravartate // //
analyzed: niścalam tu yadā cittam tadā dṛṣṭiḥ pravartate
translated: But when the mind is still, then the vision proceeds.

original: sā ca dṛṣṭiḥ parājñeyā trailokyaṃ paśyate kṣaṇāt /
analyzed: sā ca dṛṣṭiḥ parājñeyā trailokyam paśyate kṣaṇāt
translated: And that vision should be known as supreme, it sees the three worlds in an instant.

original: agamyaṃ gamyate caiva alakṣyaṃ lakṣyate tadā // //
analyzed: agamyam gamyate ca eva alakṣyam lakṣyate tadā
translated: The unattainable is reached, and then the unobservable is observed.

original: anādanādamadhyasthā vyaktāvyaktaṃ suniścalam /
analyzed: anāda nāda madhya sthā vyakta avyaktam su niścalam
translated: The unborn, the unborn, the one in the middle, the manifest and the unmanifest, very still,

original: tadā pravartate nidrā yogadhyānaparāyaṇā // //
analyzed: tadā pravartate nidrā yoga dhyāna parāyaṇā
translated: Then sleep proceeds, devoted to yoga and meditation.

original: p / ānandaṃ bhakṣayed yastu amṛtāmṛtasambhavam /🔽pravartate nirānandaṃ niścalasthāvavarjitam // //
analyzed: ānandam bhakṣayet yaḥ tu amṛta amṛta sambhavam  pravartate nirānandam niścala sthāva varjitam
translated: He who consumes bliss, which arises from nectar and immortality,🔽Proceeds in the absence of bliss, devoid of stillness and motion.

original: niraupamyaṃ nirābhāsaṃ dhyānadhāraṇavarjitam /
analyzed: niraupamyam nirābhāsam dhyāna dhāraṇa varjitam
translated: Without comparison, without appearance, devoid of meditation and retention,

original: śūnyaṃ kṛtvā tato dṛṣṭiṃ śūnyaṃ caiva tu lakṣayet // //
analyzed: śūnyam kṛtvā tatas dṛṣṭim śūnyam ca eva tu lakṣayet
translated: Having made the vision empty, one should perceive emptiness itself.

original: śūnyaṃ śūnyaṃ punaḥ śūnyaṃ triśūnyamucyate kṣaṇāt /
analyzed: śūnyam śūnyam punar śūnyam triśūnyam ucyate kṣaṇāt
translated: Empty, empty, and again empty, is said to be the triple emptiness in an instant.

original: sarvaṃ śūnyaṃ nirābhāsa sāmarasyaṃ tadā bhavet // //
analyzed: sarvam śūnyam nirābhāsa sa amarasyam tadā bhavet
translated: Everything is empty, without appearance, then there is unity.

original: ghṛte ghṛtaṃ yathā kṣiptaṃ kṣīre kṣīraṃ tathaiva ca /
analyzed: ghṛte ghṛtam yathā kṣiptam kṣīre kṣīram tathā eva ca
translated: Just as ghee is poured into ghee, and milk into milk,

original: kevalatvaṃ yadā prāptaṃ na kiñcidapi cintayet // //
analyzed: kevala tvam yadā prāptam na kiñcid api cintayet
translated: When oneness is attained, one should not think of anything at all.

original: niskāmocchvāsikāṃstyaktvā pūrakaścāmṛtī bhavet /
analyzed: niskāma ucchvāsikān tyaktvā pūrakaḥ ca amṛtī bhavet
translated: Having abandoned desireless exhalations, and inhalations, one becomes immortal.

original: kumbhakaṃ ca yadāproktaṃ yogināṃ yogadhāraṇāt // //
analyzed: kumbhakam ca yadā proktam yoginām yoga dhāraṇāt
translated: And when Kumbhaka is mentioned, it is due to the Yoga practice of yogis.

original: nivṛttiryatra jāyeta sarvaṃ śūnyaṃ pravartate /
analyzed: nivṛttiḥ yatra jāyeta sarvam śūnyam pravartate
translated: Where cessation occurs, everything arises as empty.

original: śūnyamadhyagataṃ śūnyaṃ sthitaṃ vyomani vyomavat // //
analyzed: śūnya madhya gatam śūnyam sthitam vyomani vyoma vat
translated: The emptiness within emptiness abides like space within space.

original: p / na raktaṃ na ca vā pītaṃ na śuklaṃ kṛṣṇameva ca /
analyzed: na raktam na ca vā pītam na śuklam kṛṣṇam eva ca
translated: It is neither red nor yellow, neither white nor black.

original: sarvairguṇairvinirmuktaḥ sthānātītaṃ parāparam // //
analyzed: sarvaiḥ guṇaiḥ vinirmuktaḥ sthāna atītam para aparam
translated: Free from all qualities, it transcends all states, being both supreme and non-supreme.

original: pūrakaṃ ca tvayā proktaṃ kumbhakaṃ ca punaḥ punaḥ /
analyzed: pūrakam ca tvayā proktam kumbhakam ca punar punar
translated: You have spoken of Puraka and again and again of Kumbhaka.

original: namāmi durlabhaṃ devaṃ kathaṃ jānanti mānavāḥ // //
analyzed: namāmi durlabham devam katham jānanti mānavāḥ
translated: I bow to the rare God. How do humans know Him?

original: vāyunā pūrakaṃ kṛtvā kumbhakaṃ kumbhavat punaḥ /
analyzed: vāyunā pūrakam kṛtvā kumbhakam kumbha vat punar
translated: Having filled with air and again made Kumbhaka like a pot,

original: māyā hyeṣā kṛtā vatsa yena muhyanti jantavaḥ // //
analyzed: māyā hi eṣā kṛtā vatsa yena muhyanti jantavaḥ
translated: O child, this is indeed Maya by which living beings are deluded.

original: kumbhakaṃ ca idaṃ kṛtvā hṛtsthānaṃ rūpavarjitam /
analyzed: kumbhakam ca idam kṛtvā hṛd sthānam rūpa varjitam
translated: Having made this Kumbhaka, the abode in the heart devoid of form,

original: antaḥ śarīrasaṃsthaṃ tu na bāhyaṃ tu kadācana // //
analyzed: antar śarīra saṃstham tu na bāhyam tu kadācana
translated: which is within the body but never outside.

original: sarvaṃ sa paramaṃ nāma pūrakaṃ cedamucyate /
analyzed: sarvam sa paramam nāma pūrakam ca idam ucyate
translated: Everything is that supreme name, and this is called Puraka.

original: tatrotpannaṃ yathākāśaṃ niścalasthānavarjitam // //
analyzed: tatra utpannam yathā ākāśam niścala sthāna varjitam
translated: There, like space arisen, devoid of a still place,

original: idaṃ śāntaṃ tathā putra brūhyenaṃ ca svatantrataḥ /
analyzed: idam śāntam tathā putra brūhi enam ca svatantrataḥ
translated: O son, speak of this peace, which is independent.

original: nandinā kriyate mudrā oṣṭhau tatra prapīḍitau // //
analyzed: nandinā kriyate mudrā oṣṭhau tatra prapīḍitau
translated: The mudra is made by Nandi, with the lips pressed there.

original: p / śivaṃ dhyātvā munīndraistu na kiñcidapi cintayet /
analyzed: śivam dhyātvā muni indraiḥ tu na kiñcid api cintayet
translated: Having meditated on Shiva, the lord of sages, one should not think of anything at all.

original: santuṣṭohaṃ mahābhogirkathitaṃ te svatantrataḥ // //
analyzed: santuṣṭaḥ aham mahā bhogiḥ kathitam te svatantrataḥ
translated: I am content, O great enjoyer, it has been told to you independently.

original: mayātītaṃ paraṃ śāntaṃ vāgjāla parivarjitam /
analyzed: mayā atītam param śāntam vāc jāla parivarjitam
translated: By me, the past, the supreme peace, devoid of the net of words,

original: madbhāvasandhimākhyātaṃ bhāvayecca punaḥ punaḥ // //
analyzed: mad bhāva sandhim ākhyātam bhāvayet ca punar punar
translated: The union with my nature has been declared, and one should meditate on it again and again.

original: abhāve bhāvanā cātra mahārtha hitalocanaḥ /
analyzed: abhāve bhāvanā ca atra mahārtha hita locanaḥ
translated: And here, in the absence of meditation, the one who sees the great benefit,

original: na śaknomi mahābhoginyadi janmaśatairapi // //
analyzed: na śaknomi mahā bhogini adi janma śataiḥ api
translated: I am not able, O great enjoyer, even in hundreds of births.

original: bhāvayet paramānandaṃ yaḥ svaṃ vedasamuktitam /
analyzed: bhāvayet parama ānandam yaḥ svam veda samuktitam
translated: One should meditate on the supreme bliss, which is one's own as declared by the Vedas,

original: anantaṃ śūnyamityuktaṃ hṛcchūnyaṃ rūpavarjitam // //
analyzed: anantam śūnyam iti uktam hṛd śūnyam rūpa varjitam
translated: The infinite is said to be empty, the emptiness of the heart, devoid of form.

original: nāntaḥ śarīre saṃsthā tu na bāhye tu kadācana /
analyzed: na antar śarīre saṃsthā tu na bāhye tu kadācana
translated: It is not located in the body, nor ever outside.

original: sarvaṃ samarasaṃ nāma niṣṭhāśūnyaṃ pravartate // //
analyzed: sarvam samarasam nāma niṣṭhā śūnyam pravartate
translated: Everything flows as the essence of equality, the culmination being emptiness.

original: pare śūnye pralīnāste svarūpaṃ naiva vidyate /
analyzed: pare śūnye pralīnāḥ te sva rūpam na eva vidyate
translated: They are merged in the supreme emptiness, their own nature is not known.

original: manobuddhirahaṅkāraṃ sthitaṃ mādvīkaśūlavat // //
analyzed: manaḥ buddhiḥ ahaṅkāram sthitam mādvīka śūla vat
translated: The mind, intellect, and ego exist like a bee trapped in a jar.

original: p / indriyāṇi tu śūnyāni pare śūnye layaṃ gatāḥ /
analyzed: indriyāṇi tu śūnyāni pare śūnye layam gatāḥ
translated: The senses are empty, merged in the supreme emptiness.

original: pare śūnye yadālīnaḥ svarūpaṃ naiva dṛśyate // //
analyzed: pare śūnye yad ālīnaḥ sva rūpam na eva dṛśyate
translated: When the other is empty, what is dependent on it is not seen at all.

original: tūryaiḥ paṭarunādaiśca janakolāhalaistathā /
analyzed: tūryaiḥ paṭaru nādaiḥ ca jana kolāhalaiḥ tathā
translated: With musical instruments, the sound of cymbals, and the clamor of people,

original: yukti tattvasya niṣṇāto na manaḥ paricālyate // //
analyzed: tattvasya niṣṇātaḥ na manaḥ paricālyate
translated: One who is skilled in the truth of reasoning does not move the mind.

original: mayābandhaṃ kṛtaṃ vatsa sthānaṃ dhyānaṃ carācaram /
analyzed: mayā ābandham kṛtam vatsa sthānam dhyānam carācaram
translated: O child, I have created the bondage, the place, and the meditation of the moving and unmoving.

original: kevalasya kutaḥ sthānaṃ dhyānaṃ tasya na vidyate // //
analyzed: kevalasya kutas sthānam dhyānam tasya na vidyate  /
translated: How can there be a place for the solitary one? He has no meditation.

original: dhāraṇādi na cāstīti sarvaśūnyaṃ ca nirguṇam /
analyzed: dhāraṇā ādi na ca asti iti sarva śūnyam ca nirguṇam
translated: There is no retention and so on, everything is empty and without qualities.

original: nirguṇaṃ ca paraṃ bhittvā bhittvā caiva mayā kṛtam // //
analyzed: nirguṇam ca param bhittvā bhittvā ca eva mayā kṛtam
translated: Having pierced through the qualityless supreme one, I have created it again and again.

original: svecchayā sa rasaṃ nāma atyucchinnaṃ samantataḥ /
analyzed: sva icchayā sa rasam nāma ati ucchinnam samantataḥ
translated: By his own will, he has made the extremely lofty Rasa all around.

original: dhanurdharo yathā śūra ākarṇaṃ pūrayeccharaḥ // //
analyzed: dhanurdharaḥ yathā śūraḥ ākarṇam pūrayet śaraḥ
translated: Just as a heroic archer would fill the ear with an arrow,

original: lakṣyaṃ bhitvā tato lakṣyamevaṃ yogī satāhitaḥ /
analyzed: lakṣyam bhitvā tatas lakṣyam evam yogī satā āhitaḥ
translated: Having pierced the target, the yogi, thus benefiting the good,

original: na dhanurna ca vā kāṇḍaṃ lakṣyaṃ puruṣameva ca // //
analyzed: na dhanuḥ na ca vā kāṇḍam lakṣyam puruṣam eva ca
translated: There is no bow, no arrow, no target, and no man.

original: evaṃ jñātvā paraṃ tattvaṃ sthitaṃ vyomani vyomavat /
analyzed: evam jñātvā param tattvam sthitam vyomani vyoma vat
translated: Having known the supreme truth in this way, abiding in the sky like the sky,

original: p / āpūryānyatamaṃ kāṇḍaṃ stambha dṛṣṭi vyavasthitam // //
analyzed: āpūrya anyatamam kāṇḍam stambha dṛṣṭi vyavasthitam
translated: Having filled one of the arrows, the pillar is seen to be established.

original: idaṃ tattvaṃ yadā prāptaṃ na kiñcidapi cintayet /
analyzed: idam tattvam yadā prāptam na kiñcid api cintayet
translated: When this truth is attained, one should not think of anything at all.

original: na cittaṃ na ca vā buddhirna sthānaṃ varṇameva ca // //
analyzed: na cittam na ca vā buddhiḥ na sthānam varṇam eva ca
translated: Not mind, not intellect, not a place, not even a letter,

original: na ca dhyānaṃ na vā dhyeyaṃ na granthirvāyumeva ca /🔽na granthaṃ na ca vā granthī na binduṃ nādameva ca // //
analyzed: na ca dhyānam na vā dhyeyam na granthiḥ vāyum eva ca  na grantham na ca vā granthī na bindum nādam eva ca
translated: Not meditation, not an object of meditation, not a knot, not even air,🔽Not a book, not even knots, not a dot, not sound,

original: na lakṣyaṃ na ca vā lakṣī na śikhā turyameva ca /
analyzed: na lakṣyam na ca vā lakṣī na śikhā turyam eva ca
translated: Not a target, not even a mark, not a flame, not even the fourth state,

original: tedau madhyaṃ yadā prāpta na kiñcidapi cintayet // //
analyzed: madhyam yadā na kiñcid api cintayet
translated: When the middle is attained, one should not think of anything at all.

original: na vāyuṃ na ca vā kāśaṃ na vahniṃ salilaṃ tathā /
analyzed: na vāyum na ca vā kāśam na vahnim salilam tathā
translated: Not air, not even space, not fire, not water,

original: na somaṃ na ca vā sūryaṃ na brahmā viṣṇureva ca // //
analyzed: na somam na ca vā sūryam na brahmā viṣṇuḥ eva ca
translated: Not the moon, not even the sun, not Brahma, not Vishnu,

original: na rudraṃ na ca vā kālamīśvaraṃ śivameva ca /
analyzed: na rudram na ca vā kālam īśvaram śivam eva ca
translated: Not Rudra, not even time, not the Lord, not Shiva,

original: anākhyaṃ ca nirābhāsaṃ nistattvaṃ ca nirāśrayam // //
analyzed: anākhyam ca nirābhāsam nistattvam ca nirāśrayam
translated: Unnamed, without appearance, without essence, without support,

original: channaṃ sarvagataṃ śāntaṃ sthitaṃ vyomeṣu vyomavat /
analyzed: channam sarva gatam śāntam sthitam vyomeṣu vyoma vat
translated: Concealed, all-pervading, peaceful, abiding in the spaces like space.

original: tadā pravartate kiñcit paśyamena punaḥ punaḥ // //
analyzed: tadā pravartate kiñcid paśyamena punar punar
translated: Then something begins to move, and one sees again and again.

original: p / tanmānaṃ ca punaḥ kṛtvā sthūlaṃ śūnye pralīyate /
analyzed: tad mānam ca punar kṛtvā sthūlam śūnye pralīyate
translated: Having again made that measure, the gross dissolves into emptiness.

original: sūkṣmaṃ śūnyaṃ yadā prāptaṃ pare śūnye pralīyate // //
analyzed: sūkṣmam śūnyam yadā prāptam pare śūnye pralīyate
translated: When the subtle void is attained, it dissolves into the supreme void.

original: tasmin sthāne śubhe prāpte niścale nirguṇe tathā /
analyzed: tasmin sthāne śubhe prāpte niścale nirguṇe tathā
translated: Having attained that auspicious place, which is immovable and devoid of qualities,

original: tatraiva dhārayeccittaṃ yadanyostīti kāraṇam // //🔽eṣā sā paramākāṣṭhā paraṃ cittaṃ tathaiva ca /
analyzed: tatra eva dhārayet cittam yat anyaḥ asti iti kāraṇam  eṣā sā paramā ākāṣṭhā param cittam tathā eva ca
translated: One should fix the mind there itself, for the sake of which others exist.🔽This is the supreme limit, and the supreme mind is just like that.

original: eṣā sā paramā buddhiḥ parā cāpi pravartate // //
analyzed: eṣā sā paramā buddhiḥ parā ca api pravartate
translated: This is the supreme intellect, and the supreme one also proceeds.

original: yoginastu tataḥ praśnaṃ patate nātrasaṃśayaḥ /
analyzed: yoginaḥ tu tatas praśnam patate na atra saṃśayaḥ
translated: Then the question of the yogis falls, there is no doubt about this.

original: idaṃ viṣṇurvijānīyāt pāśaḥ krodhena cchidyate // //
analyzed: idam viṣṇuḥ vijānīyāt pāśaḥ krodhena chidyate  /
translated: This should be known by Vishnu, the noose is cut by anger.

original: mahatāṃ sarvadevānāṃ matvādevaśca kīrtitaḥ /
analyzed: mahatām sarva devānām matvā devaḥ ca kīrtitaḥ
translated: And the god of gods is proclaimed as the lord of the great ones.

original: tārayecca prajāḥ sarvāstumburustena cocyate // //
analyzed: tārayet ca prajāḥ sarvāḥ tumburuḥ tena ca ucyate
translated: And he delivers all beings, therefore he is called Tumburu.

original: īśvaratve tathāpīṣa īśvaratvaṃ prakīrtitam /
analyzed: īśvara tve tathā api iṣe īśvara tvam prakīrtitam
translated: And in lordship, he is proclaimed as the lord.

original: harate sarvapāpāni haro devaḥ prakīrtitaḥ // //
analyzed: harate sarva pāpāni haraḥ devaḥ prakīrtitaḥ
translated: He removes all sins, therefore the god is proclaimed as Hara.

original: layanaṃ sarva jātīnāṃ layanālliṅgamucyate /
analyzed: layanam jātīnām layanāt liṅgam ucyate
translated: The abode of all beings, therefore it is called Linga.

original: evaṃ sarvagataṃ devaṃ brahmarūpo na nirmalaḥ // //
analyzed: evam sarva gatam devam brahma rūpaḥ na nirmalaḥ
translated: Thus the all-pervading god is not manifest in the form of Brahman.

original: krimikīṭapataṅgeṣu sthāvare jaṅgameṣu ca /
analyzed: krimi kīṭa pataṅgeṣu sthāvare jaṅgameṣu ca
translated: In worms, insects, moths, immobile and moving beings,

original: yatkiñcidvāṅmayaṃ sarvaṃ sṛṣṭidevaṃ pakīrtitam // //
analyzed: yat kiñcid vāc mayam sarvam sṛṣṭidevam
translated: Whatever is expressed in words is declared to be the creation of God.

original: tasya devātidevasya śaktirnādayate jagat /
analyzed: tasya devātidevasya śaktiḥ nādayate jagat
translated: The power of that God of gods resounds in the world.

original: evaṃ sarvagataṃ śūnyaṃ hṛdaye tatra lakṣayet // //
analyzed: evam sarva gatam śūnyam hṛdaye tatra lakṣayet  /
translated: Thus, the all-pervading void should be seen in the heart there.

original: yadi sarvagataṃ deva śūnyaṃ brūhi kimucyate /
analyzed: yadi sarva gatam deva śūnyam brūhi kim ucyate
translated: If the void is all-pervading, O God, tell me what is it?

original: atha śūnyaṃ paraṃ brahmalakṣaṇaṃ grahaṇaṃ kutaḥ // //
analyzed: atha śūnyam param brahma lakṣaṇam grahaṇam kutas
translated: Or if the void is the supreme Brahman, how is it grasped?

original: bhagavandevadeveśa candrārdhakṛtaśekhara /
analyzed: bhagavan devadeveśa candra ardha kṛta śekhara
translated: O Lord, God of gods, with the crest adorned with the half-moon,

original: etat praśnaṃ paraṃ guhyaṃ prasādaṃ kuru śūlabhṛt // //
analyzed: etat praśnam param guhyam prasādam kuru śūlabhṛt
translated: Please grace me with this supreme secret question, O bearer of the trident.

original: ṣaḍaṅgena tu yogena hṛdyaṃ śūnyaṃ tu grāhayet /
analyzed: ṣaḍaṅgena tu yogena hṛdyam śūnyam tu grāhayet
translated: The void in the heart should be grasped through the yoga of the six limbs.

original: pūrṇaṃ nivartanaṃ tena pūrṇaṃ bhāvaṃ ca lakṣayet // //
analyzed: pūrṇam nivartanam tena pūrṇam bhāvam ca lakṣayet
translated: The full return is by that, and the full state should be seen.

original: pūrṇāhutiṃ tato dadyāddīkṣākāle samāśrite /
analyzed: pūrṇāhutim tatas dadyāt dīkṣā kāle samāśrite
translated: Then, the full oblation should be given at the time of initiation.

original: p / bhāvitātmā sa yogena siddhiḥ khecaratāṃ vrajet // //
analyzed: bhāvita ātmā sa yogena siddhiḥ khecara tām vrajet
translated: The accomplished one, whose soul is purified by yoga, attains the state of flying in the sky.

original: prāṇāyāmaṃ tathā dhyānaṃ pratyāhāraṃ ca dhāraṇā /
analyzed: prāṇāyāmam tathā dhyānam pratyāhāram ca dhāraṇā
translated: Breath control, meditation, sense withdrawal, concentration,

original: tarkaścaiva samādhiśca ṣaḍaṅgo yoga ucyate // //
analyzed: tarkaḥ ca eva samādhiḥ ca ṣaṣ aṅgaḥ yogaḥ ucyate
translated: Discernment, and absorption - this is said to be the six-limbed yoga.

original: etajjñāna mayaṃ proktaṃ jñeyaṃ śūnyaṃ prakīrtitam /
analyzed: etat jñāna mayam proktam jñeyam śūnyam prakīrtitam
translated: This is said to be the knowledge, and the void is declared to be the object of knowledge.

original: indriyāśca tataḥ śūnyaṃ cittaṃ śūnyaṃ tathaiva ca // //
analyzed: indriyāḥ ca tatas śūnyam cittam śūnyam tathā eva ca
translated: Then the senses are empty, the mind is empty, and so is consciousness.

original: buddhiśūnyaṃ vijānīyādātmaśūnyaṃ tataḥ punaḥ /
analyzed: buddhi śūnyam vijānīyāt ātma śūnyam tatas punar
translated: One should know the intellect to be empty, and then the self to be empty.

original: agniśūnyaṃ tataḥ kṛtvā dharmaśūnyaṃ ca niṣkalam // //
analyzed: agni śūnyam tatas kṛtvā dharma śūnyam ca niṣkalam
translated: Having made the fire empty, and the Dharma empty, without parts,

original: nirdhumaṃ ca paraṃ śūnyaṃ kumbhamadhye jalaṃ yathā /
analyzed: nirdhumam ca param śūnyam kumbha madhye jalam yathā
translated: The supreme emptiness is smokeless, like water in the middle of a pot.

original: himakāle tu saṃprāpte vivarṇaṃ niścalaṃ bhavet // //
analyzed: hima kāle tu saṃprāpte vivarṇam niścalam bhavet
translated: When the cold season arrives, it becomes colorless and motionless.

original: evaṃ khaṃkāṣṭhadhūstadvatkhatiṣṭhe dviniyojayet /
analyzed: evam khaṃ kāṣṭha dhūḥ tadvat kha tiṣṭhe dviniyojayet
translated: Thus, the sky and wood are like that. One should apply the two in the sky.

original: idaṃ tatvaṃ yadāprāptaṃ paśyate / janma bandhanāt // //
analyzed: idam yadā aprāptam paśyate janma bandhanāt
translated: When this truth is attained, one sees birth as bondage.

original: p / na pravarteta cādvaitaṃ gṛhasthasya kadācana /
analyzed: na pravarteta ca advaitam gṛhasthasya kadācana
translated: And non-duality would never occur for a householder.

original: indriyebhyo yataḥ saktaḥ saktomātsarya eva ca // //
analyzed: indriyebhyaḥ yatas saktaḥ saktaḥ mātsaryaḥ eva ca
translated: Because he is attached to the senses, and is also attached to stinginess.

original: avidyā grāhayedrāgamatarāgaṃ punaḥ punaḥ /
analyzed: avidyā grāhayet rāgam ata rāgam punar punar
translated: Ignorance would grasp attachment, and non-attachment again and again.

original: tasmānnivartate tatvaṃ cittaṃ yena na nirjitam // //
analyzed: tasmāt nivartate cittam yena na nirjitam
translated: Therefore, the truth does not turn away from that mind which is not conquered.

original: nirjitaṃ ca yadā cittaṃ tadā śreyaḥ pravartate /
analyzed: nirjitam ca yadā cittam tadā śreyaḥ pravartate
translated: But when the mind is conquered, then excellence proceeds.

original: śānto dānto jitakrodho bhikṣāśī vigata spṛhaḥ // //
analyzed: śāntaḥ dāntaḥ jita krodhaḥ bhikṣā āśī vigata spṛhaḥ
translated: The mendicant, peaceful, self-controlled, anger conquered, desiring little,

original: idaṃ tu yogine dṛṣṭvā nandanīyaḥ prayatnataḥ /
analyzed: idam tu yogine dṛṣṭvā nandanīyaḥ prayatnataḥ
translated: Seeing this, the yogi should strive to be delighted.

original: darśanānmocayet pāpaṃ sparśanāddīkṣito bhavet // //
analyzed: darśanāt mocayet pāpam sparśanāt dīkṣitaḥ bhavet
translated: By seeing it, one is freed from sin, by touching it, one becomes initiated.

original: ālāpātgatra /saṃparkādbhojanācchayanāsanāt /
analyzed: ālāpāt gatra saṃparkāt bhojanāt śayana asanāt
translated: By conversation, by contact with the body, by eating, by sleeping and sitting,

original: kulānaddharate skanda daśapūrvāndaśāparān // //
analyzed: kulān addharate skanda daśa pūrvān daśa aparān
translated: O Skanda, one elevates ten generations before and ten after, the family.

original: pakvaṃ caiva pratijñānaṃ ghaṭikā ca caturvidhām /
analyzed: pakvam ca eva pratijñānam ghaṭikā ca caturvidhām
translated: The cooked, the vow, and the four types of Ghatika,

original: prathamaṃ dhūli bhedaṃ ca dvitīyaṃ hṛcchedabandhanam // //
analyzed: prathamam dhūli bhedam ca dvitīyam hṛccheda bandhanam
translated: The first is the division of the dust, the second is the binding of the division in the heart,

original: p / tṛtīyaṃ granthi bhedaṃ ca caturthaṃ paramucyate /
analyzed: tṛtīyam granthi bhedam ca caturtham param ucyate
translated: The third is the division of the knot, and the fourth is said to be supreme.

original: cittasambodhamātreṇa kathaṃ gṛhṇanti tatpadam // //
analyzed: citta sambodha mātreṇa katham gṛhṇanti tat padam
translated: How do they grasp that state merely by the awakening of the mind?

original: kena vā gṛhyate cittaṃ kasmin sthāne pralīyate /
analyzed: kena vā gṛhyate cittam kasmin sthāne pralīyate
translated: By whom is the mind grasped, and in what place does it dissolve?

original: devadeva mahādeva sarvastattvārthabhedaka // //
analyzed: devadeva mahādeva sarvaḥ tattva artha bhedaka
translated: O God of gods, great god, the divider of all tattva meanings,

original: brūhi me paramaṃ jñānaṃ yena siddhyanti sādhakāḥ //
analyzed: brūhi me paramam jñānam yena siddhyanti sādhakāḥ
translated: Tell me the supreme knowledge by which the practitioners succeed.

original: khaṭikā procyate mokṣamuddharet granthi bhedataḥ /
analyzed: khaṭikā procyate mokṣam uddharet granthi bhedataḥ
translated: The Ghatika is said to be liberation, it should be extracted by dividing the knots.

original: khamiva paramaṃ jñātvā khaṭikeṣā prakīrtitā // //
analyzed: kham iva paramam jñātvā khaṭikā īṣā prakīrtitā
translated: Having known the supreme like the sky, the Ghatika is proclaimed.

original: cittaṃ citte tu saṅgṛhya buddhau buddhiṃ tathaiva ca /
analyzed: cittam citte tu saṅgṛhya buddhau buddhim tathā eva ca
translated: Having collected the mind in the mind, and the intellect in the intellect,

original: sā tu buddhiḥ parājñeyā tatvamārgānu sāriṇī // //
analyzed: sā tu buddhiḥ parājñeyā tatva mārga anu sāriṇī
translated: That intellect should be known as supreme, following the path of reality.

original: śṛṇu śūnyasya vai lakṣyaṃ dharaṃ viśati tatkṣaṇāt /🔽praviṣṭe ca pare tatve samatvaṃ jāyate kṣaṇāt // //
analyzed: śṛṇu śūnyasya vai lakṣyam dharam viśati tad kṣaṇāt  praviṣṭe ca pare tatve samatvam jāyate kṣaṇāt
translated: Listen to the characteristic of emptiness, which instantly enters the earth.🔽And when the supreme reality has entered, equality arises in an instant.

original: p / samatvaṃ ca yadā prāptaṃ parānandaṃ prajāyate /
analyzed: sama tvam ca yadā prāptam para ānandam prajāyate
translated: When equality has been attained, supreme bliss arises.

original: parānandaṃ yadā prāptaṃ na kiñcidapi cintayet // //
analyzed: para ānandam yadā prāptam na kiñcid api cintayet
translated: When supreme bliss has been attained, one should not think of anything at all.

original: praviśet tanmayo bhūtvā śivabījena sādhakaḥ /
analyzed: praviśet tad mayaḥ bhūtvā śivabījena sādhakaḥ
translated: The practitioner should enter, becoming one with that, through the seed of Shiva.

original: tadā na śrūyate śabdaṃ śaṅkhabherī sa dundubhiḥ // //
analyzed: tadā na śrūyate śabdam śaṅkha bherī sa dundubhiḥ
translated: Then the sound of the conch, the bheri, and the dundubhi are not heard.

original: tāḍitaṃ ca na bindeta tatastanmayatāṃ gataḥ /
analyzed: tāḍitam ca na bindeta tatas tad maya tām gataḥ
translated: And when struck, he does not feel it, having become one with that.

original: etat te paramaṃ guhyaṃ paraṃ jñeyaṃ na saṃśayaḥ // //
analyzed: etat te paramam guhyam param jñeyam na saṃśayaḥ
translated: This is the supreme secret for you, the supreme knowledge, there is no doubt.

original: idaṃ pratyayamāpannaṃ tatguruḥ pāśahā bhavet /
analyzed: idam pratyayam āpannam tad guruḥ pāśa hā bhavet
translated: The guru who has attained this confidence becomes the destroyer of the bonds.

original: puṣpaṃ patraṃ phalaṃ toyaṃ yo dīkṣāṃ kurute naraḥ // //
analyzed: puṣpam patram phalam toyam yaḥ dīkṣām kurute naraḥ
translated: The man who offers flowers, leaves, fruits, or water and performs initiation,

original: navanābhaṃ tato yāgaṃ kṛtaṃ tena na saṃśayaḥ /
analyzed: nava nābham tatas yāgam kṛtam tena na saṃśayaḥ
translated: has undoubtedly performed the nine-navel sacrifice.

original: anyathā kurute dīkṣāṃ tatgururbrahmahā bhavet // //
analyzed: anyathā kurute dīkṣām tad guruḥ brahma hā bhavet
translated: If the guru performs initiation otherwise, he becomes a killer of Brahman.

original: bhāvanāyāstathā śaiva dvaitaṃ caivamaśeṣataḥ /
analyzed: bhāvanāyāḥ tathā śaiva dvaitam ca evam aśeṣatas
translated: Thus, the duality of Shaivism and the rest of the meditations

original: kliśyante te mahāmūḍhāḥ saṃsāre ca punaḥ punaḥ // //
analyzed: kliśyante te mahā mūḍhāḥ saṃsāre ca punar punar
translated: those greatly deluded ones suffer again and again in the world.

original: dvaitaṃ caiva mahādvaitaṃ dvaitaikatvaṃ tathaiva ca /
analyzed: dvaitam ca eva mahādvaitam dvaita eka tvam tathā eva ca
translated: Duality, great duality, duality and oneness,

original: p / advaitaṃ na ca vā dvaitamatirme paramārthataḥ // //
analyzed: advaitam na ca vā dvaita matiḥ me paramārthāt
translated: And non-duality, not even duality - this is my highest truth.

original: vaṃśaṃ nāmamayājñātaṃ tvatprasādānmaheśvara /
analyzed: vaṃśam nāma mayā ajñātam tvad prasādāt maheśvara
translated: I have understood the lineage, the name, and the mantra through your grace, Mahesvara.

original: mahārathaṃ kīdṛśaṃ ca jaṭā vai kīdṛśī bhavet // //
analyzed: mahā ratham kīdṛśam ca jaṭā vai kīdṛśī bhavet
translated: What is the great chariot like? And what are the matted locks like?

original: bhāsa /nāma kimutpannaṃ kiṃ vā khaṭvāṅgamucyate /
analyzed: bhāsa nāma kim utpannam kim vā khaṭvāṅgam ucyate
translated: What is the origin of the name Bhasa? And what is called Khatvanga?

original: saṃkṣepādvadadeveśa yena mokṣaṃ dhruvaṃ bhavet // //
analyzed: saṃkṣepāt vadat eva īśa yena mokṣam dhruvam bhavet
translated: Tell me in brief, O Lord of gods, by which liberation would certainly be attained.

original: bhāvayeccāparaṃ śūnyamanantaṃ parivarjitam /
analyzed: bhāvayet ca aparam śūnyam anantam parivarjitam
translated: And one should contemplate the supreme void, infinite, devoid of everything,

original: bhavacchedakaraṃ śāntaṃ paraṃ kasmataducyate // //
analyzed: bhavat cheda karam śāntam param
translated: Which cuts off worldly existence, is peaceful, and is called the supreme cause.

original: jaṭāvat snāpayeccittaṃ jaṭā hyetāḥ prakīrtitāḥ /
analyzed: jaṭā vat snāpayet cittam jaṭāḥ hi etāḥ prakīrtitāḥ
translated: One should bathe the mind as if it were matted locks, for these are declared to be matted locks.

original: mahāsnānaṃ tadā proktaṃ mahāvrataṃ taducyate // //
analyzed: mahāsnānam tadā proktam mahāvratam tat ucyate
translated: That is said to be the great bath, and that is called the great vow.

original: nāsti tatparamānandaṃ cittakaṃ cittavarjitam /🔽tataḥ khakāṣṭavattiṣṭhet khaṭvāṅgaṃ tādṛśaṃ bhavet // //
analyzed: na asti tat parama ānandam cittakam citta varjitam  tatas kha kāṣṭa vat tiṣṭhet khaṭvāṅgam tādṛśam bhavet
translated: There is no higher bliss than that, which is mental and devoid of mind.🔽Therefore, one should stand like a stick of khadira wood. Such is the Khatvanga.

original: p / evaṃ gūḍhaṃ vijānīyāt guhavāsī tathocyate /
analyzed: evam gūḍham vijānīyāt guha vāsī tathā ucyate
translated: One should know the hidden in this way. One is then said to be a dweller in the cave.

original: na nāma grahaṇān mukto na kāya tamanācchuciḥ // //
analyzed: na nāma grahaṇāt muktaḥ na kāya tamanāt śuciḥ
translated: One is not liberated by merely uttering the name, nor is one pure by merely controlling the body and mind.

original: cittaṃ dhāmayate prājño mokṣa ityabhidhīyate /
analyzed: cittam dhāmayate prājñaḥ mokṣaḥ iti abhidhīyate
translated: The wise one purifies the mind, which is called liberation.

original: vratasyā caraṇaṃ kṛtvā yogaṃ tatra samabhyaset // //
analyzed: caraṇam kṛtvā yogam tatra samabhyaset  /
translated: Having performed the observance, one should practice yoga there.

original: mayātīte paraṃbrahma lokatrayavivarjitam // //
analyzed: mayā atīte paraṃbrahma loka traya vivarjitam
translated: After I have passed away, the supreme Brahman, devoid of the three worlds,

original: vratena sahitā yogāḥ svayaṃ proktā maheśvara /
analyzed: vratena sahitāḥ yogāḥ svayam proktāḥ maheśvara
translated: The yogas along with the observance have been proclaimed by Mahesvara himself.

original: yogahīna vratāmuḍhā mudrā pañcaka bhūṣitāḥ // //
translated: Those who are ignorant of the observance lacking in yoga, adorned with the five mudras,

original: etanme saṃśayaṃ brūhi yena nissaṃśayo bhavet // //
analyzed: etat me saṃśayam brūhi yena nissaṃśayaḥ bhavet
translated: Please tell me this doubt, so that I may be free from doubt.

original: vratena sahitā yogāḥ sarvaṃ siddhi pradāḥ śubhāḥ /
analyzed: vratena sahitāḥ yogāḥ sarvam siddhi pradāḥ śubhāḥ
translated: The yogas along with the observance, all bestow auspicious accomplishments.

original: yogahīnavratāmūḍhā na mucyanti kadācana // //
analyzed: yoga hīna vratā amūḍhāḥ na mucyanti kadācana
translated: Those ignorant of the observance lacking in yoga are never liberated.

original: vratasya caraṇaṃ kṛtvā lokayātrā vivarjitam /
analyzed: vratasya caraṇam kṛtvā lokayātrā vivarjitam
translated: Having performed the observance devoid of worldly conduct,

original: p / nispṛho nispṛhe nityaṃ samaloṣṭāśma kāñcanaḥ // //
analyzed: nispṛhaḥ nispṛhe nityam sama loṣṭa aśma kāñcanaḥ
translated: Devoid of desires, always regarding a clod of earth, a stone, and gold as the same,

original: śabdaṃ sparśaṃ rasaṃ rūpaṃ gandhaṃ caiva tu pañcamam /
analyzed: śabdam sparśam rasam rūpam gandham ca eva tu pañcamam
translated: Sound, touch, taste, form, and smell as the fifth,

original: etāmudrā mahatyaśca mucyate caturaṃ jagat // //
analyzed: mucyate caturam jagat
translated: These are the great mudras by which the four-fold world is liberated.

original: iti mukto vrajenmokṣaṃ yatra devo nirañjanaḥ //🔽i śrī rva ddhā ni ṇa go raṃ mā m //
analyzed: iti muktaḥ vrajet mokṣam yatra devaḥ nirañjanaḥ  i śrī rva ddhā ni na go raṃ mā
translated: Thus liberated, one attains liberation where the god is free from impurities.🔽Thus ends the chapter on the observance.

original: śivaṃ bhavatu //
analyzed: śivam bhavatu
translated: May there be welfare.
